<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 326, 294]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 299, 154, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 278, 905, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/13 May/June 2019 2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 420, 354]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 437, 374]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 715, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 384, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 282, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 545]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 599, 559]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 604, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 606, 599]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 599, 759, 614]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 613, 440, 628]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 91]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 164, 561, 183]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 195, 240, 213]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 373, 244]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2} + b x + c = 0,\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 243, 586, 280]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 301, 228, 319]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[248, 322, 747, 361]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 369, 480, 406]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 470, 594, 489]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 502, 156, 520]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 530, 581, 600]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 629, 242, 647]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 653, 590, 686]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 705, 590, 725]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 732, 556, 761]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 69, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
Jack has won 7 trophies for sport and wants to arrange them on a shelf. He has 2 trophies for cricket, 4 trophies for football and 1 trophy for swimming. Find the number of different arrangements if

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 180, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 117, 376, 135]]<|/det|>
there are no restrictions,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 117, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 240, 180, 259]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 240, 520, 259]]<|/det|>
the football trophies are to be kept together,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 241, 920, 260]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 459, 180, 477]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 457, 870, 477]]<|/det|>
the football trophies are to be kept together and the cricket trophies are to be kept together. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 180, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 117, 376, 135]]<|/det|>
there are no restrictions,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 241, 400, 259]]<|/det|>
all the girls are in the team,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 243, 920, 260]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 397, 180, 415]]<|/det|>

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 144]]<|/det|>
A curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} = \left(2x + 3\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}\). The curve has a gradient of 5 at the point where \(x = 3\) and passes through the point \(\left(\frac{1}{2}, -\frac{1}{3}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
A pilot wishes to fly his plane from a point \(A\) to a point \(B\). The bearing of \(B\) from \(A\) is \(050^{\circ}\). A wind is blowing from the north at a speed of \(120\mathrm{kmh}^{-1}\). The plane can fly at \(600\mathrm{kmh}^{-1}\) in still air.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 119, 144, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 119, 703, 135]]<|/det|>

<mark>[4]

<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 444, 796, 460]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 444, 920, 460]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
